item.title: BBR: Congestion-Based Congestion Control
item.description: Measuring bottleneck bandwidth and round-trip propagation time

item.title: The Raspberry Pis
item.description:
For our servers and clients, we used 8 raspberry pi 3B+ running a modified Raspbian image. Each of these can be purchased for under $50. As they run Linux, they are able to run all of the different congestion control algorithms (specially, we are interested in BBR).

We provide information on the steps we took to recompile the Kernel, as well as performance measurements for the Pis.

item.title: Experimental Evaluation of BBR Congestion Control
item.description:
Mario Hock, Roland Bless, Martina Zitterbart Karlsruhe Institute of Technology Karlsruhe, Germany

Validates BBR with a series of tests. Discusses the following limitations:

  1. Estimate of bandwidth is available share.

  2. Esimate of bandwidth is always too high.

item.title: CS244 2017: ReBBR: Reproducing BBR Performance in Lossy Networks
PCC: Re-architecting Congestion Control for Consistent High Performance
item.description:
Mo Dong et. al. 15

A congestion control protocol using a ‘black-box’ approach to networks. The algorithm relies on utility functions and mini experiments to adjust sending rate.

item.title: The Router
item.description: The router is an ubuntu desktop with 3 nic cards. One card is used for the normal ‘wide area network’, and the other two cards are used to route between the two raspberry pi subnets.

item.title: Copa: Practical Delay-Based Congestion Control for the Internet
item.description:
Venkat Arun et. al. NSDI 2018

Uses a black-box approach to congestion control similar to PCC. This improves on PCC’s experiment idea and includes delay in its utility function.

item.title: Multiple Flow Convergence
item.description:
Given multiple bbr flows competing at the same bottleneck, all of the flows should sync. BBR has a mechanism to drain the queue and check for a lowest round trip time after some amount of seconds since the last time the round trip time changed. With multiple flows, they all should see the change in round trip time at the same time, so they should begin to drain the queue at the same time.
